content:
âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: as the name, Easy Peasy, Short and "Shifty" AND fun but somehow tricky in a good way
I think it also can be reverse because it have a lot of test cases and so simple
(I know a lot of reverse puzzle that harder than this)

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like it. Most of the contributions here are way to difficult to solve in 15 minutes. Challanges like this one are the reason clash of code works as well as it does. The statement is short and clear, you know immediately what to to and where to start.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Puzzle easily comprehensible and solvable under 5 min

Hi,

Good puzzle, it can also be used on fastest mode !

Could you please specify the direction of the shift (we shift left, meaning the char at the beginning should go at the end, which is not obvious... many may think that we shift >> , meaning the last char should go to the beginning).

It's clearer with the example but should be specified.
Also could you put a constraint on s.length ?

Thank you

Input
* Please add line numbers in <<bold>>, i.e. "<<Line 1>>" and "<<Line 2>>".

* Please change "number" to "integer".

Constraints
* Please delete the first constraint, which is already covered by the second constraint.

Cases
* Each pair of test and validator should be similar if possible. Hence, I would suggest to swap Validator 3 and Validator 6, so that Test 3 and Validator 3 are similar.
(That is the most obvious one. It's even better if you can do the same with the other pairs.)

* Suggest to add a pair of cases where the shift is greater than the length of the string (which I think your solution code doesn't handle).

Thanks.

Hi, thanks for your suggestions. I'm currently working on it. I'll see how I can improve the contribution. 

Oh, interesting... you're correct, my solution code can't handle it. I'll tinker with it. I'll also take a look at the cases... I might add more.

Thanks again, Code-Parser.

Hello, thanks for your reply. I will do my best to clarify the instructions, and I will also add it to Fastest mode. I will see to [s]'s constraint.

Thanks again, Code-Parser.

Thanks very much, @Anastazor, I'm glad that you approve of it. ðŸ˜„

Happy Coding, Code-Parser.

Hello, Aypee. Thanks so much for approving this contribution!

I'm glad you like it, and I hope others will too.
I wish you all the best.

Happy Coding, Code-Parser.

Thanks so much!!!

Wish you all the best!

Thank you for making the changes. Below are my comments based on the revised version:

Input
* Please format the line numbers in <<bold>>, i.e. "<<Line 1>>" and "<<Line 2>>".

Output
* Please format the line number, i.e. "<<Line 1>>".

Cases
* Please keep each pair of test and validator similar as much as possible. Also, some situations have not been covered. Hence, I would suggest to:

  â€¢ change Test 3 so that [[n]] is negative and the absolute value of [[n]] is greater than the length of [[s]] (similar to Validator 3).

  â€¢ change any one of the Tests 4/5/6/7/8 so that [[n]] is zero, and copy Validator 10 as its corresponding validator.

  â€¢ copy Test 11 so that it becomes Validator 10, which is similar to Test 10.

  â€¢ change Test 11 so that [[n]] is positive and equal to the length of [[s]] (similar to Validator 11).

  â€¢ change any one of the pairs 4/5/6/7/8 so that [[n]] is negative and its absolute value is equal to the length of [[s]].

  â€¢ change any one of the pairs 4/5/6/7/8 so that [[n]] is positive and is greater than AND is a multiple of the length of [[s]].

  â€¢ change any one of the pairs 4/5/6/7/8 so that [[n]] is negative and its absolute value is greater than AND is a multiple of the length of [[s]].

Thanks again.

Thank you. Regarding your questions:

Test 3: Sorry about that. I've corrected my comment as "greater" instead of "smaller".

Only shifting the letters back like the input: Correct, exactly that, it's just similar to the cases where n = 0.

New lines: Added, see if that helps.

Thanks.

Hello, 5DN1L. Thanks for the changes, it's easier to read now... I've also done recreated Test 11 and created Test 12.

I hope that I have done all the changes that you've suggested.

Thanks again, Code-Parser.

Thank you for creating a case with my name as part of the input! ðŸ¥°

Constraints
* Please change "[[s]]" to "length of [[s]]".

* The last validator is inconsistent with the length constraint. Please change either the constraint or the last validator.

Cases
* Pair 6 (both test and validator): Please change [[n]] to negative (i.e. 9 to -9 and 4 to -4)

* "Good Job Coder!" (Test 11): Please change the case so that [[n]] is a multiple of the length of [[s]], e.g. by changing [[n]] to -48.

Making these two changes will ensure better coverage of different scenarios. ðŸ˜‰

Thanks again.

Hello again, I have reviewed and submitted the changes you suggested. I have change Validator 12's string to be consistent with the constraint.

Anything else?

As for your name, I appreciate all the time you're spending on my contribution and for your tips. So it's the least I could do. :)

Thanks, Code-Parser.

One more fix:
* Please change [[n]] to -48 for Test 11 (Good Job Coder!).

(It seems that Test 12 ([CREDITS AND THANKS]) was modified instead?)

Thanks.

Hello, sorry about that. I got mixed up with Test 12 and Test 11, but I've fixed it now. Yes Test 12 is modified still.

I have also added a solution for the SHORTEST mode in comments underneath my normal Solution.

Before I begin the Validation Process, May I ask three last questions?

- Is the name of the contribution ok? It is quite long.

- Should I have this contribution for all three modes, or only for FASTEST and SHORTEST like I have it at the moment?

- Do you have any other suggestions or critiques of this contribution?

Thanks, Code-Parser.

Sure, it's good to ask questions.

Name of contribution: It's fine.

Game modes: I guess Reverse mode is doable, but it's my opinion only.

Suggestions: No other suggestions from me. I haven't tried actually writing a code to solve the clash. Maybe others who do will have some suggestions for you. ðŸ™‚

Ok, thanks.

I appreciate all the help and suggestions you've given me. 

Thanks for everything, Code-Parser.

Happy Coding!!! :)
